page.title: 01A Cotswold Idyll
page.content: The{Cowley area}in Gloucestershire lies in the undulating oolitic limestone Cotswold Hills which rise to 270 metres above sea level. Predominantly rural in character, the area supports mostly arable farming. Walks around the area are popular with tourists and two local inns provide attractive resting places. Wild life can be easily encountered particularly pheasant, rabbits and magpies and sometimes deer, foxes and badgers. The villages are mostly dormitory settlements for the nearby towns of Cheltenham and Cirencester, although a small nucleus of people still work on the land. There is quite a high proportion of indigenous retired people. Cowley Manor, Churnside Camp and the Guide HQ draw visitors, many of them young people, into the area and attest to its natural beauty.
